1.comment: text_block - a multi-line block of text

2.name: text_block

0.value:
This is a text block. 

It can have multiple lines.

2.text:
This is a text block. 

It can have multiple lines.

3.name: text_block

0.name: block
0.value:
The text block node places a resizable, multi-line text editor directly onto the node graph canvas.

Like the comment node, it renders with a transparent background to blend into the workspace, 
but it provides a larger, scrollable area suitable for longer paragraphs. 

You use this node for extensive documentation, changelogs, keeping project notes, or pasting code 
snippets for reference.

SYNTAX:
text_block <text: string>

EXAMPLE:
text_block Phase 1: Initialization logic

OPTIONS: (these are only visible if you select the top bar of the text block and press 'o')

[Main Text Area]:
The central editor widget. You can type or paste multi-line text here.

lock:
When checked, the text editor becomes read-only. 
The content cannot be edited, preventing accidental changes, but text can still be selected and copied.

width:
Sets the horizontal size of the text editor in pixels.

height:
Sets the vertical size of the text editor in pixels.

text_size:
Selects the visual size of the text inside the editor. 
Available options are 24, 30, 36, and 48.

OUTPUTS: 

None. 
This node is purely visual and has no data output.

3.text:

Like the comment node, it renders with a transparent background to blend into the workspace, 
but it provides a larger, scrollable area suitable for longer paragraphs. 

You use this node for extensive documentation, changelogs, keeping project notes, or pasting code

SYNTAX:

[Main Text Area]:
The central editor widget. You can type or paste multi-line text here.

lock:
When checked, the text editor becomes read-only. 
The content cannot be edited, preventing accidental changes, but text can still be selected and copied.

width:
Sets the horizontal size of the text editor in pixels.

height:
Sets the vertical size of the text editor in pixels.

text_size:
Selects the visual size of the text inside the editor. 
Available options are 24, 30, 36, and 48.

OUTPUTS:

This node is purely visual and has no data output.
